text: Piotr Krystian Domaradzki (June 21, 1946 – November 4, 2015) was a Polish- American journalist, essayist and historian. He had a longtime association with Chicago's Polish community. He worked for 30 years at Dziennik Związkowy (Alliance Daily), the oldest and largest Polish language newspaper in the United States. From October 2009 to March 2013, he served as the paper's editor-in-chief.2009 masthead of Dziennik Związkowy indicating Piotr Domaradzki as editor-in-chief He emigrated from Poland in 1984 and became a U.S. citizen in 1996. Domaradzki died in Chicago, Illinois from complications following injuries sustained in a house fire, aged 69.Nickeas, Peter and Sadovi, Carlos.
